CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 22, 1952, pg. 6 reads: "To Benefit From Hill City Cavalcade - Hill City Band, shown here, and the Hill City Music Department will benefit from, the "Cavalcade of Local Stars" show to be held at Schenley High School on Thursday evening, March 27. on the program will be Lloyd "Fatman" as master of ceremonies, the Eddie and Erwin Comedy and Dance Team, the Hill City Majorettes, the Howe Ballet Dancers, "Khando, the Great." Magician, the Swan Chorale and music by the Musicians Local 471."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Hill City Youth Municipality Band, including Malcolm Hill with drum on left, Roland Saunders with trumpet fourth from right, Donald Williams with drum second from right, Director Raymond Harris holding conductor's baton on left, and James H. Williams wearing suit and overcoat on right, posed at attention in front of brick and stone building
